intro: Camptosema acuminatum, commonly known as the sharp-pointed camptosema, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and lobed leaves, which are often covered in fine pubescence. Its flowers are typically pink or purple, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. Camptosema acuminatum is often found in dry, open habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid conditions.
